play:PlayType.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
play:PlayType.sceneDescription: SCENE Athens, and a wood near it.

fm.p: Text placed in the public domain by Moby Lexical Tools, 1992.
Altered slightly by Bryan Dollery, 2003, for inclusion in an article on XML parsing in Java. Published in DevX (www.devx.com) in February 2003
This work may be freely copied and distributed worldwide.

personae.title: Dramatis Personae
personae.persona: PHILOSTRATE, master of the revels to Theseus.
HIPPOLYTA, queen of the Amazons, betrothed to Theseus.
HERMIA, daughter to Egeus, in love with Lysander.
Other fairies attending their King and Queen.

scene.title: SCENE I. Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
scene.stageDirections: Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, PHILOSTRATE, and Attendants

speech.speaker: THESEUS
speech.line: Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour
